definition: (of a device) designed to accept a cassette, cartridge or canister (loanword from "cassette")/designed to have a card or ticket inserted (also written 插卡式[cha1 ka3 shi4]) (loanword from "card")
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette
type/form/pattern/style
portable gas stove (fueled by a gas cartridge)
(of a device, e.g. public telephone, ticket inspection machine) designed to have a card or ticket inserted

sentences.english: In a Basilican church (see Basilica), which has side aisles, nave refers only to the central section .
sentences.chinese: 在有侧堂的巴西利卡式教堂中，中堂仅指中央部分。

sentences.english: She was listening to her cassette tape when she suddenly saw a man standing on the side of the road.
sentences.chinese: 她正听着卡式录音磁带，突然看见一个男人站在路边。

sentences.english: We launched the first cardless ATM.
sentences.chinese: 我们推出了首个无卡式自动柜员机。

sentences.english: Temperature control module is plug-in card designed, easy to use and maintain .
sentences.chinese: 温控模块采用插卡式设计，维修方便快捷，易于操作。

sentences.english: The combination of cassette mold seat and stripping system can manage continuous operation.
sentences.chinese: 卡式模座和剥皮系统的组合使机台达到连惯动作。

sentences.english: Temperature control by card avoids adjustment by others.
sentences.chinese: 插卡式温度控制防止其他人调校。

sentences.english: It is the era of ancient Rome's Basilica style evolved.
sentences.chinese: 它是从古罗马时代的巴西利卡式演变而来。

sentences.english: Plug-in card temperature control, to prevent arbitrary changing welding temperature.
sentences.chinese: 插卡式温度控制，防止随意改动焊接温度。

sentences.english: Plug-in temperature control, responding to prevent random changes welding temperature.
sentences.chinese: 插卡式温度控制，防止随意改动焊接温度。

sentences.english: Twister and applicator can be changed quickly.
sentences.chinese: 扭线机与卡式模可快速切换。
